definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
to bend the rules/to skirt around the issue
(table tennis) edge ball/(fig.) actions that are technically legal but perhaps not respectable
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to make use of one's position to gain profit for oneself or one's associates
bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to sell directly/direct sale (by a factory)/direct marketing
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4
